definitions: written or printed with small letters rather than capital letters
examples: Please write your password in lowercase letters only
The email address should be entirely lowercase

definitions: moved or brought down to a position that is less high than before
made smaller in degree, intensity, amount, or value than previously
examples: The flag was lowered to half-mast in mourning
She lowered her voice to a whisper
The store lowered prices for the holiday sale
Interest rates were lowered to stimulate the economy

definitions: looking dark and threatening, especially describing sky or weather conditions
examples: The lowering clouds promised an approaching storm
Under the lowering sky, we hurried back home

definitions: situated at the lowest or bottom position in a series or structure
examples: The lowermost shelf was covered in dust
We found fossils in the lowermost rock layer

definitions: at the smallest or minimum degree, amount, or level possible
holding the least important position in a hierarchy or ranking
examples: The temperature reached its lowest point last night
This product offers the lowest price in town
He started at the lowest position in the company
The lowest ranking officer led the patrol

definitions: relating to or characteristic of land that is low and relatively flat
examples: The lowland regions are prone to flooding
Lowland farming differs from mountain agriculture

definitions: low in status, rank, or importance in society or an organization
having or showing a modest or humble opinion of oneself
examples: He rose from lowly beginnings to great success
The lowly clerk eventually became company president
She maintained a lowly attitude despite her achievements
His lowly demeanor concealed his vast knowledge

definitions: applied with oil or grease to reduce friction between moving parts
examples: The well-lubricated engine ran smoothly and quietly
Keep the hinges lubricated to prevent squeaking

definitions: expressed clearly and easy to understand with logical coherence
able to think clearly and rationally, especially between periods of confusion
examples: Her lucid explanation helped everyone understand the concept
The professor gave a lucid presentation on quantum physics
The patient had lucid moments during her illness
Despite his age, his mind remained perfectly lucid

definitions: producing a large amount of profit or financial gain
examples: Real estate can be a lucrative investment opportunity
She left teaching for a more lucrative career

definitions: so foolish, unreasonable, or out of place as to be amusing and ridiculous
examples: The idea of flying cars seemed ludicrous decades ago
His ludicrous excuse made everyone laugh out loud

definitions: only slightly warm, between cool and warm in temperature
showing little enthusiasm, interest, or conviction about something
examples: The coffee had turned lukewarm while we talked
She prefers lukewarm water for washing her face
The audience gave a lukewarm response to the performance
His lukewarm support disappointed the campaign team

definitions: relating to the lower part of the back between the ribs and pelvis
examples: The lumbar spine supports much of body weight
He needed lumbar support while sitting at work

definitions: moving in a slow, heavy, and awkward way due to size or weight
examples: The lumbering elephant moved slowly through the jungle
His lumbering gait made him easy to recognize

definitions: emitting light not caused by heat through chemical or biological processes
examples: The luminescent algae made the ocean glow at night
Fireflies produce luminescent signals to attract mates

definitions: full of light or shining brightly, especially in darkness
very clear and easy to understand intellectually or spiritually enlightening
examples: The luminous dial glowed softly in the dark
Stars appeared as luminous points in the sky
Her luminous prose made complex ideas accessible to all
The scientist's luminous explanation clarified the theory

definitions: full of lumps or covered with bumps making an uneven surface
examples: The old mattress had become uncomfortably lumpy
She stirred the gravy to prevent lumpy texture

definitions: of, determined by, or relating to the moon or its movements
examples: The lunar calendar follows the moon's phases
Scientists studied lunar soil samples from the mission

definitions: extremely foolish, eccentric, or absurd in behavior or ideas
affected with periodic insanity dependent on moon phases historically
examples: That lunatic driver nearly caused a terrible accident
It was a lunatic idea to climb without equipment
The old asylum housed those considered lunatic patients
Medieval beliefs linked lunatic behavior to moon phases

definitions: presented in vividly shocking or sensational terms, especially involving violence or immorality
unnaturally bright in color, especially red, orange, or yellow
examples: The tabloid featured lurid details of the scandal
He avoided lurid crime novels before bedtime
The lurid sunset painted the sky in reds
Lurid flames engulfed the abandoned building at night

definitions: having a pleasingly rich, sweet taste or smell that appeals strongly
very attractive in a way that suggests sensual pleasure
examples: The luscious peaches dripped with sweet juice
She served luscious chocolate cake for dessert
The model's luscious lips appeared in every advertisement
He described her in luscious terms that embarrassed everyone

definitions: growing thickly and strongly with rich, abundant vegetation
very rich, abundant, and appealing to the senses luxuriously
examples: The lush rainforest teemed with exotic plants
Their lush garden required constant watering and care
The hotel featured lush furnishings and golden fixtures
Her lush voice filled the concert hall beautifully

definitions: having or showing strong feelings of sexual desire or appetite
examples: His lustful gaze made her feel uncomfortable
The novel depicted lustful characters in ancient Rome

definitions: having a soft glow or shine reflecting light gently and attractively
examples: Her lustrous hair caught everyone's attention at parties
The pearl's lustrous surface gleamed in the light

definitions: healthy, vigorous, and full of strength and energy
characterized by or showing strong sexual desire
examples: The lusty infant cried loudly for milk
His lusty appetite required hearty meals three times daily
The lusty young men whistled at passing women
Medieval tales often featured lusty knights and maidens

definitions: of the highest quality characterized by elegance and luxury
examples: The luxe hotel suite featured marble and gold
She preferred luxe fabrics like silk and cashmere

definitions: growing profusely with thick and abundant vegetation or foliage
characterized by rich and profuse elaboration or ornamentation
examples: The luxuriant vines covered the entire garden wall
Her luxuriant hair required special care and attention
The palace featured luxuriant decorations in every room
His luxuriant prose style overwhelmed some readers completely

definitions: extremely comfortable, elegant, and expensive suggesting great wealth and indulgence
examples: They stayed in a luxurious resort by the ocean
The luxurious leather seats made driving a pleasure

definitions: relating to lymph or the system of vessels that transport it
examples: The lymphatic system helps fight infections in body
Lymphatic drainage massage promotes better circulation and health

definitions: expressing personal emotions or feelings in an imaginative and beautiful way
examples: The poet's lyric style captured hearts and minds
She wrote lyric poetry about love and loss

definitions: expressing emotions in an imaginative and beautiful way with artistic quality
having a quality suitable for song or resembling musical expression
examples: His lyrical description of nature moved the audience
The author's lyrical prose reads like poetry
The lyrical melody stayed in my mind all day
Her lyrical voice suited the romantic ballad perfectly

definitions: disturbing and horrifying because concerned with death and injury
examples: The macabre decorations frightened the younger children away
His macabre sense of humor wasn't appreciated here

definitions: showing aggressive masculine pride and stereotypically male characteristics or behavior
examples: His macho attitude alienated many of his coworkers
The macho culture discouraged men from showing emotions

definitions: on a large scale dealing with overall or general features
examples: We need to consider macro economic trends carefully
The macro view reveals patterns invisible up close

definitions: relating to the large-scale or overall behavior of a national economy
examples: Macroeconomic policies affect employment rates across the country
The report analyzed macroeconomic indicators for the year

definitions: large enough to be visible to the naked eye without magnification
examples: The macroscopic damage to the building was extensive
Some crystals grow to macroscopic size over time

definitions: amusingly eccentric, unconventional, and wildly impulsive in behavior or ideas
examples: Their madcap adventure took them across three continents
She was known for her madcap schemes and pranks

definitions: manufactured, created, or produced rather than natural or spontaneous
certain to be successful or to have achieved success
examples: These shoes are made from recycled materials entirely
The made bed looked inviting after long day
With his connections, he's a made man now
Once you're in that club, you're made for life

definitions: of a color that is a deep purplish-red or reddish-purple
examples: She wore a stunning magenta dress to the gala
The magenta flowers added color to the garden

definitions: having or showing great authority and comprehensive knowledge or understanding
having or showing an overly dignified or domineering manner
examples: His magisterial work on economics won several awards
The professor's magisterial tone commanded respect from students
Her magisterial manner intimidated the younger staff members
He dismissed their concerns with magisterial indifference

definitions: very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person
examples: The magnanimous victor shook hands with his opponent
Her magnanimous donation saved the community center from closing

definitions: having the properties of a magnet able to attract iron or steel
very attractive or alluring with a powerful charm
examples: The magnetic field affected all nearby metal objects
Keep magnetic items away from computer hard drives
Her magnetic personality drew people to her naturally
The speaker had a magnetic presence on stage

definitions: given magnetic properties or made into a magnet
examples: The magnetized needle pointed steadily toward magnetic north
Once magnetized, the metal attracted iron filings easily

definitions: extremely beautiful, impressive, or elaborate deserving great admiration
examples: The magnificent cathedral took centuries to build completely
They watched a magnificent sunset over the ocean

definitions: made to appear larger than actual size using optical instruments
increased in actual or apparent importance, intensity, or severity
examples: The magnified image revealed hidden details clearly
Through the magnified lens, bacteria became visible
His small mistake was magnified by the media
Fear magnified every sound in the dark house

definitions: being the first or earliest of its kind happening
of or relating to an unmarried girl or young woman
examples: The ship's maiden voyage attracted worldwide media attention
Her maiden speech in parliament impressed senior members
The maiden aunt lived alone in the countryside
In maiden days, she dreamed of grand adventures

definitions: sent through the postal system or by electronic mail
covered with or wearing armor made of metal rings or plates
examples: The mailed invitations arrived just in time
She mailed the package yesterday via express delivery
The mailed knight rode into battle confidently
His mailed fist struck the wooden shield hard

definitions: wounded or injured so that part of the body is permanently damaged
examples: The accident left him maimed but not defeated
Many soldiers returned maimed from the terrible war

definitions: kept in good condition by checking or repairing regularly
continued at the same rate, level, or state without interruption
examples: The well-maintained garden bloomed throughout the season
Their maintained equipment rarely needed emergency repairs
She maintained her composure during the crisis
The team maintained their lead until the end

definitions: having or showing impressive beauty, dignity, or grandeur
examples: The majestic mountains rose above the morning clouds
Eagles soared with majestic grace across the sky
